intro: Coffea vavateninensis, commonly known as the Vavatenina coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to Madagascar. This rare plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. The fruit is a red, fleshy berry containing two seeds, which are used to make coffee. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
